Comment: Respectively: male and female. Also mean 'boy' 02.250, and 'girl' 02.260.
Respectively: male and female. Also mean 'boy' 02.250, and 'girl' 02.260.
*EMB form is *itua'ba. *EMB form for suffix meaning 'limiting, only' *-bai; **Chocoan form is **-bai.
The latter is used for very far away.
The latter is used for very far away.
Affix cannot be used alone. *EMB form is *'i; **Chocoan form is **'i.
*EMB form is *ɨ̃'rɨ; **Chocoan form is **ɨ̃'rɨ. *EMB form is *ɨ̃kɨ'taa / *ɨ̃kɨ'tɨrɨ; **Chocoan form is **ɨ̃kɨ'taa / **ɨ̃kɨ'tɨrɨ.
The former is preferred for objects in motion.
The former is preferred for objects in motion.
The former from Span. 'plata'. The latter is more archaic.
The former from Span. 'plata'. The latter is more archaic.
*EMB forms are *če-; *uru-; **Chocoan forms are **če-; **uru-. *EMB form for 'came' is *čia'ra.
*EMB form is *toa-; **Chocoan form is **toa-. *EMB for 'split wood' is *tope-/ toape; **Chocoan form is **tope-/ toape.
Also mean, respectively: 'body' 04.110; and 'bone' 04.160. Both terms are used commonly.
Also mean, respectively: 'body' 04.110; and 'bone' 04.160. Both terms are used commonly.
Also means 'eye' 04.210. *EMB form is *da'bu; **Chocoan form is **da'bu.
Means to broadcast corn seed. *EMB form is *uu-.
Both words refer to wooden bench-like pillows. The latter is archaic.
Both words refer to wooden bench-like pillows. The latter is archaic.
*EMB form is *de; **Chocoan form is **de. Also reconstructed for a suffix **-de, meaning 'container, cavity, empty'. Cf. 'shell' 03.655.
Lit. 'waist-tied'. Refers to the string which holds the man's loincloth.
Used for sugarcane mead or rum, but not corn. See previous note.
Usually sweet and fleshy. Cf. 'honey' 05.840. *EMB form is *nẽ'hõ; **Chocoan form is **neme-hõ. See 'thing' 11.180. Also *EMB *'ta / *nẽ'ta. Cf. 'seed' 08.311.
Made of corn, plantains, or rice, and wrapped in leaves.
From Span. 'tenaza', wooden tongs used to handle embers and hot objects in the hearth.
Refers to a spoon made from a gourd. Also [ku'sar̃a], from Span. 'cuchara'.
Used in different contexts; the latter is used for sucking fruits, or the sucking done by shamans for healing. *EMB form is *hõ-; **Chocoan form is **hõ-.
Used in different contexts; the latter is used for sucking fruits, or the sucking done by shamans for healing. *EMB form is *hõ-; **Chocoan form is **hõ-.
Also means 'river' 01.360. *EMB form is *do-; **Chocoan form is **do-, same as 'water'.
Lit. 'breast-point'; cf. 'beak' 04.241; 'tooth' 04.270. *EMB form is *'hu; **Chocoan form is **'hu.
From Span. 'pecho'. *EMB form is *'trũa; **Chocoan form is **'tũra.
Refers in general to the lower limb: 'leg, foot, toe'. Cf. 04.330. *EMB form is *hĩ'ru.
Refers in general to the upper limb: 'arm, hand, finger'. *EMB form is *hu'a; **Chocoan form is **hu'a.
Lit. 'face-penis' 04.492, prob. shape morpheme, such as 'blade'. *EMB form is *kĩ'rame; **Chocoan form is **meu.
*EMB form is *kẽ'bu; **Chocoan form is **kẽ'bu. Proto form for 'headwaters' is lit. 'river (water)-nose': *EMB *do-kẽ'bu; **Chocoan **do-kẽ'bu.
Lit. 'eye-hair'. *EMB form is *da'bu ka'ra; **Chocoan form is **da'bu ka'ra.
Also means 'top' 12.330. *EMB form is *bo'ro; **Chocoan form is **bo'ro.
*EMB form is *bɨru-'rɨ; suffix is formative, cf. 'ear' 04.220. **Chocoan form is **βɨ.
Respectively: male and female. Cf. 'penis' 04.492; kẽ is 'vagina'.
Respectively: male and female. Cf. 'penis' 04.492; kẽ is 'vagina'.
Means 'covering/shell'; cf. 03.655. Cf. 'house' 07.120. *EMB form is *'e; **Chocoan form is **'eu.
A river turtle. Many other varieties.
A common green lizard, lit. 'sunshine-sunshine-taker'. Many other varieties. *EMB form for 'iguana' is *opo'ga; **Chocoan form is **opo'ka.
*EMB form is *boko'ro; **Chocoan form is **boko'ro / **kopo'ro. *EMB for 'poison frog' is *kõ'kõĩ; **Chocoan form is **kõ'kõĩ / **ko'kõĩ.
Respectively: lights with the eye (04.210) (also means 'star' 01.540); lights with the abdomen.
Respectively: lights with the eye (04.210) (also means 'star' 01.540); lights with the abdomen.
Refers to 'earthworm'. *EMB form is *'ki. *EMB form for 'lombriz' is *moki'ta; **Chocoan form is **moki'ta.
*EMB form for 'mosca azul' is *ɨ̃kana; **Chocoan form is **ɨ̃kana. *EMB for 'tábano' is *'sĩta.
Lit. 'liquid-drinker'. Small c. found in the house. Other varieties are also found.
Mazama americana. *EMB form is *'βe'ki. **Chocoan form is **sũ'ra.
Lit. 'jaguar red' 15.660. Puma: Felis concolor. In the local Spanish, the 'puma' is referred to as 'león' (lion).
This morpheme cannot stand alone; follows either a determiner or a noun: ǰi-'e, 'the shell'; koro'go-e, 'snail's shell/covering' 03.940. Also cf. 'skin, hide' 04.120; and 'house' 07.120.
A South American example of the family Corvidae.
Refers to a green, middle-sized p. No generic term. *EMB form is *keke're; **Chocoan form is **keke're.
The latter preferred for non-vampire bats. *EMB form is *i'ka.
The latter preferred for non-vampire bats. *EMB form is *i'ka.
*EMB form is *'nẽ'hõbɨ; **Chocoan form is **'neme 'hõbɨ. **Chocoan form for 'gavilán quebrantahuesos' is **ua'bibi.
Archaic form. Now used is ['karsa], from Span. 'garza'.
From Span. 'cochino' + 'male'. Also [be'r̃ako], from Span. 'berraco', which is used for any other male animal.
From Span. 'animal', refers mainly to an unknown animal or to an evil spirit. *EMB form is *nẽ-; **Chocoan form is **neme. Cf. 'thing' 11.180.
*EMB forms are *'iči; *i'ru. **Chocoan forms are **i, (absolutive), **i'ru, (ergative and some other cases).
*EMB forms are *'iči; *i'ru. **Chocoan forms are **i, (absolutive), **i'ru, (ergative and some other cases).
Also means 'master', e.g. of an animal such as a dog, 19.410. *EMB form is *čaikõ're; **Chocoan form is **čai-.
Of the aunt; 'tẽã-bema, of the uncle.
Terms specifiying gender are frequently used: o'ar̃a-zake, 'son-little'; kau-zake, 'daughter-little'. See 'small' 12.560.
Also means 'female' 03.130. *EMB form is *u'ẽra; **Chocoan form is **'ɨe / **ɨẽ.
From Span. 'fósforo'. Also [lus'paru], archaic form used by some elders.
*EMB form is *hede'ko / *ede'ko; **Chocoan form is **ede. According to Loewen (1958: 86), the suffix /-kʰo/ means 'round shape'.
Cf. 'river' 01.360. 'Liquid' is -ɓa; see 'soup' 05.640. *EMB form is *do; **Chocoan form is **do. *EMB form for 'liquid' is *βa.
Also means 'understand' 17.160; 'obey' 19.460. *EMB form is *ũri-; **Chocoan form is ũri-.
*EMB form is *pu'ru; **Chocoan form is **pu'ru. Cf. *po'rea, means 'ripe (red-colored)' 05.123.
*EMB form is *bia- / *bĩa-; **Chocoan form is **βĩa-. Cf. 'cry out' 18.130.
Consonantal expression, commonly used. *EMB form is *ɨ̃-ɨ̃; **Chocoan form is **ɨ̃-ɨ̃. *EMB 'negative (suffix)' is *-ẽ / *-e.
Refers to a horn made from a marine snail shell or from a piece of bamboo, used by the shamans to call the spirit.
Refers to a beautifully carved wooden staff used by the shaman.
Means master of an animal, such as a dog. Cf. 02.610.
This is not the Christian heaven; can be translated better as the 'upper world'.
Can be translated as the 'lower world'.
Refers to the shaman. *EMB form is *hai; **Chocoan form is **hai.
